snippet: The court ruling allowing the reopening of crucial aspects of the trial suggested that senior political figures convicted in a vast vote-buying scheme may not get any hard jail time.
abstract: Brazil’s highest court allows new round of appeals in a trial over a vast vote-buying scheme, decision that may allow senior political figures in ruling Workers Party to maneuver out of hard jail time for their actions in what may be country's biggest corruption scandal.
lead_paragraph: The court ruling allowing the reopening of crucial aspects of the trial suggested that senior political figures convicted in a vast vote-buying scheme may not get any hard jail time.
